edu.nyu.cs.javagit.api.commands
Class GitLog

java.lang.Object
  edu.nyu.cs.javagit.api.commands.GitLog

public final class GitLog
extends java.lang.Object

GitLog provides an interface to retrieve logs from a git repository

Method Detail

log

public java.util.List<GitLogResponse.Commit> log(java.io.File repositoryPath,
                                                 GitLogOptions options)
                                          throws JavaGitException,
                                                 java.io.IOException
Parameters:
repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to move/rename against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
options - Specify option used to collect logs, see GitLogOptions
Returns:
A List of Commit objects
Throws:
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error executing git log.
java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is an error executing git log.

log

public java.util.List<GitLogResponse.Commit> log(java.io.File repositoryPath)
                                          throws JavaGitException,

repositoryPath - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to move/rename against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
